meanings.definition: The intention or desire to do evil; ill will.
meanings.sent1: Her malices towards her classmates were evident in her mean comments.
meanings.sent2: The malices in his heart led him to plot revenge against his enemies.
meanings.sent3: Despite their malices, the two villains couldn't agree on a plan to harm others.
meanings.sent4: The dark cloud of malices hovered over the kingdom, casting a shadow of fear.
meanings.sent5: The malices within him consumed any kindness he once had.

meanings.definition: The feeling of enmity or ill will that causes harm or injury to another.
meanings.sent1: The malices between the rival gangs escalated into a dangerous feud.
meanings.sent2: His malices towards his former friend poisoned their relationship.
meanings.sent3: The cat's malices towards the mouse were thwarted by a clever escape plan.
meanings.sent4: The malices in her words cut deeper than any physical harm.
meanings.sent5: The malices in the air were palpable, creating a tense atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A desire to harm others or to see others suffer.
meanings.sent1: His malices drove him to sabotage his colleague's work out of jealousy.
meanings.sent2: The malices in her eyes revealed her true intentions to cause pain.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous imp's malices often led to harmless pranks on unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent4: The malices of war left a trail of destruction and sorrow in their wake.
meanings.sent5: The malicious grin on his face hinted at the depth of his malices.
